extracted_data_phrases: to excesses in eating or drinking
gluttony.question: Did I give in to excesses in eating or drinking, potentially compromising my physical well-being and relationship with God?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: at risk of neglecting my needs and those of others
of neglecting my needs and those of others
prodigality.question: Have I recklessly prioritized my desires over responsible financial planning, putting myself at risk of neglecting my needs and those of others?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' personal struggles or private concerns
through conversations with friends or acquaintances
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' personal struggles or private concerns, even if what I shared was true, through conversations with friends or acquaintances?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I used words to discuss others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in criticizing others through their absence ,
perhaps by sharing private information or faults about them when they are not present to defend themselves
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in criticizing others through their absence, perhaps by sharing private information or faults about them when they are not present to defend themselves?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I engage in work on a Sunday, thereby profaning this holy day of rest?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
